name: DateStyle
full_description: Category: Client Connection Defaults / Locale and Formatting. Context: user. Description: Sets the display format for date and time values. Also controls interpretation of ambiguous date inputs.

name: IntervalStyle
full_description: Category: Client Connection Defaults / Locale and Formatting. Context: user. Description: Sets the display format for interval values.

name: TimeZone
full_description: Category: Client Connection Defaults / Locale and Formatting. Context: user. Description: Sets the time zone for displaying and interpreting time stamps.

name: allow_in_place_tablespaces
full_description: Category: Developer Options. Context: superuser. Description: Allows tablespaces directly inside pg_tblspc, for testing.

name: allow_system_table_mods
full_description: Category: Developer Options. Context: superuser. Description: Allows modifications of the structure of system tables.

name: application_name
full_description: Category: Reporting and Logging / What to Log. Context: user. Description: Sets the application name to be reported in statistics and logs.

name: archive_cleanup_command
full_description: Category: Write-Ahead Log / Archive Recovery. Context: sighup. Description: Sets the shell command that will be executed at every restart point.

name: archive_command
full_description: Category: Write-Ahead Log / Archiving. Context: sighup. Description: Sets the shell command that will be called to archive a WAL file.

name: archive_mode
full_description: Category: Write-Ahead Log / Archiving. Context: postmaster. Description: Allows archiving of WAL files using archive_command.

name: archive_timeout
full_description: Category: Write-Ahead Log / Archiving. Context: sighup. Description: Forces a switch to the next WAL file if a new file has not been started within N seconds.

name: array_nulls
full_description: Category: Version and Platform Compatibility / Previous PostgreSQL Versions. Context: user. Description: Enable input of NULL elements in arrays. When turned on, unquoted NULL in an array input value means a null value; otherwise it is taken literally.

name: authentication_timeout
full_description: Category: Connections and Authentication / Authentication. Context: sighup. Description: Sets the maximum allowed time to complete client authentication.

name: autovacuum
full_description: Category: Autovacuum. Context: sighup. Description: Starts the autovacuum subprocess.

name: autovacuum_analyze_scale_factor
full_description: Category: Autovacuum. Context: sighup. Description: Number of tuple inserts, updates, or deletes prior to analyze as a fraction of reltuples.

name: autovacuum_analyze_threshold
full_description: Category: Autovacuum. Context: sighup. Description: Minimum number of tuple inserts, updates, or deletes prior to analyze.

name: autovacuum_freeze_max_age
full_description: Category: Autovacuum. Context: postmaster. Description: Age at which to autovacuum a table to prevent transaction ID wraparound.

name: autovacuum_max_workers
full_description: Category: Autovacuum. Context: postmaster. Description: Sets the maximum number of simultaneously running autovacuum worker processes.

name: autovacuum_multixact_freeze_max_age
full_description: Category: Autovacuum. Context: postmaster. Description: Multixact age at which to autovacuum a table to prevent multixact wraparound.

name: autovacuum_naptime
full_description: Category: Autovacuum. Context: sighup. Description: Time to sleep between autovacuum runs.

name: autovacuum_vacuum_cost_delay
full_description: Category: Autovacuum. Context: sighup. Description: Vacuum cost delay in milliseconds, for autovacuum.

name: autovacuum_vacuum_cost_limit
full_description: Category: Autovacuum. Context: sighup. Description: Vacuum cost amount available before napping, for autovacuum.

name: autovacuum_vacuum_insert_scale_factor
full_description: Category: Autovacuum. Context: sighup. Description: Number of tuple inserts prior to vacuum as a fraction of reltuples.

name: autovacuum_vacuum_insert_threshold
full_description: Category: Autovacuum. Context: sighup. Description: Minimum number of tuple inserts prior to vacuum, or -1 to disable insert vacuums.

name: autovacuum_vacuum_scale_factor
full_description: Category: Autovacuum. Context: sighup. Description: Number of tuple updates or deletes prior to vacuum as a fraction of reltuples.

name: autovacuum_vacuum_threshold
full_description: Category: Autovacuum. Context: sighup. Description: Minimum number of tuple updates or deletes prior to vacuum.

name: autovacuum_work_mem
full_description: Category: Resource Usage / Memory. Context: sighup. Description: Sets the maximum memory to be used by each autovacuum worker process.

name: backend_flush_after
full_description: Category: Resource Usage / Asynchronous Behavior. Context: user. Description: Number of pages after which previously performed writes are flushed to disk.

name: backslash_quote
full_description: Category: Version and Platform Compatibility / Previous PostgreSQL Versions. Context: user. Description: Sets whether "\'" is allowed in string literals.

name: backtrace_functions
full_description: Category: Developer Options. Context: superuser. Description: Log backtrace for errors in these functions.

name: bgwriter_delay
full_description: Category: Resource Usage / Background Writer. Context: sighup. Description: Background writer sleep time between rounds.

name: bgwriter_flush_after
full_description: Category: Resource Usage / Background Writer. Context: sighup. Description: Number of pages after which previously performed writes are flushed to disk.

name: bgwriter_lru_maxpages
full_description: Category: Resource Usage / Background Writer. Context: sighup. Description: Background writer maximum number of LRU pages to flush per round.

name: bgwriter_lru_multiplier
full_description: Category: Resource Usage / Background Writer. Context: sighup. Description: Multiple of the average buffer usage to free per round.

name: block_size
full_description: Category: Preset Options. Context: internal. Description: Shows the size of a disk block.

name: bonjour
full_description: Category: Connections and Authentication / Connection Settings. Context: postmaster. Description: Enables advertising the server via Bonjour.

name: bonjour_name
full_description: Category: Connections and Authentication / Connection Settings. Context: postmaster. Description: Sets the Bonjour service name.

name: bytea_output
full_description: Category: Client Connection Defaults / Statement Behavior. Context: user. Description: Sets the output format for bytea.

name: check_function_bodies
full_description: Category: Client Connection Defaults / Statement Behavior. Context: user. Description: Check routine bodies during CREATE FUNCTION and CREATE PROCEDURE.

name: checkpoint_completion_target
full_description: Category: Write-Ahead Log / Checkpoints. Context: sighup. Description: Time spent flushing dirty buffers during checkpoint, as fraction of checkpoint interval.

name: checkpoint_flush_after
full_description: Category: Write-Ahead Log / Checkpoints. Context: sighup. Description: Number of pages after which previously performed writes are flushed to disk.

name: checkpoint_timeout
full_description: Category: Write-Ahead Log / Checkpoints. Context: sighup. Description: Sets the maximum time between automatic WAL checkpoints.

name: checkpoint_warning
full_description: Category: Write-Ahead Log / Checkpoints. Context: sighup. Description: Enables warnings if checkpoint segments are filled more frequently than this. Write a message to the server log if checkpoints caused by the filling of checkpoint segment files happens more frequently than this number of seconds. Zero turns off the warning.

name: client_connection_check_interval
full_description: Category: Connections and Authentication / Connection Settings. Context: user. Description: Sets the time interval between checks for disconnection while running queries.

name: client_encoding
full_description: Category: Client Connection Defaults / Locale and Formatting. Context: user. Description: Sets the client's character set encoding.

name: client_min_messages
full_description: Category: Client Connection Defaults / Statement Behavior. Context: user. Description: Sets the message levels that are sent to the client. Each level includes all the levels that follow it. The later the level, the fewer messages are sent.

name: cluster_name
full_description: Category: Reporting and Logging / Process Title. Context: postmaster. Description: Sets the name of the cluster, which is included in the process title.

name: commit_delay
full_description: Category: Write-Ahead Log / Settings. Context: superuser. Description: Sets the delay in microseconds between transaction commit and flushing WAL to disk.

name: commit_siblings
full_description: Category: Write-Ahead Log / Settings. Context: user. Description: Sets the minimum concurrent open transactions before performing commit_delay.

name: compute_query_id
full_description: Category: Statistics / Monitoring. Context: superuser. Description: Compute query identifiers.

name: config_file
full_description: Category: File Locations. Context: postmaster. Description: Sets the server's main configuration file.

name: constraint_exclusion
full_description: Category: Query Tuning / Other Planner Options. Context: user. Description: Enables the planner to use constraints to optimize queries. Table scans will be skipped if their constraints guarantee that no rows match the query.

name: cpu_index_tuple_cost
full_description: Category: Query Tuning / Planner Cost Constants. Context: user. Description: Sets the planner's estimate of the cost of processing each index entry during an index scan.

name: cpu_operator_cost
full_description: Category: Query Tuning / Planner Cost Constants. Context: user. Description: Sets the planner's estimate of the cost of processing each operator or function call.

name: cpu_tuple_cost
full_description: Category: Query Tuning / Planner Cost Constants. Context: user. Description: Sets the planner's estimate of the cost of processing each tuple (row).

name: cursor_tuple_fraction
full_description: Category: Query Tuning / Other Planner Options. Context: user. Description: Sets the planner's estimate of the fraction of a cursor's rows that will be retrieved.

name: data_checksums
full_description: Category: Preset Options. Context: internal. Description: Shows whether data checksums are turned on for this cluster.

name: data_directory
full_description: Category: File Locations. Context: postmaster. Description: Sets the server's data directory.

name: data_directory_mode
full_description: Category: Preset Options. Context: internal. Description: Shows the mode of the data directory. The parameter value is a numeric mode specification in the form accepted by the chmod and umask system calls. (To use the customary octal format the number must start with a 0 (zero).)

name: data_sync_retry
full_description: Category: Error Handling. Context: postmaster. Description: Whether to continue running after a failure to sync data files.

name: db_user_namespace
full_description: Category: Connections and Authentication / Authentication. Context: sighup. Description: Enables per-database user names.

name: deadlock_timeout
full_description: Category: Lock Management. Context: superuser. Description: Sets the time to wait on a lock before checking for deadlock.

name: debug_assertions
full_description: Category: Preset Options. Context: internal. Description: Shows whether the running server has assertion checks enabled.

name: debug_discard_caches
full_description: Category: Developer Options. Context: superuser. Description: Aggressively flush system caches for debugging purposes.

name: debug_pretty_print
full_description: Category: Reporting and Logging / What to Log. Context: user. Description: Indents parse and plan tree displays.

name: debug_print_parse
full_description: Category: Reporting and Logging / What to Log. Context: user. Description: Logs each query's parse tree.

name: debug_print_plan
full_description: Category: Reporting and Logging / What to Log. Context: user. Description: Logs each query's execution plan.

name: debug_print_rewritten
full_description: Category: Reporting and Logging / What to Log. Context: user. Description: Logs each query's rewritten parse tree.

name: default_statistics_target
full_description: Category: Query Tuning / Other Planner Options. Context: user. Description: Sets the default statistics target. This applies to table columns that have not had a column-specific target set via ALTER TABLE SET STATISTICS.

name: default_table_access_method
full_description: Category: Client Connection Defaults / Statement Behavior. Context: user. Description: Sets the default table access method for new tables.

name: default_tablespace
full_description: Category: Client Connection Defaults / Statement Behavior. Context: user. Description: Sets the default tablespace to create tables and indexes in. An empty string selects the database's default tablespace.

name: default_text_search_config
full_description: Category: Client Connection Defaults / Locale and Formatting. Context: user. Description: Sets default text search configuration.

name: default_toast_compression
full_description: Category: Client Connection Defaults / Statement Behavior. Context: user. Description: Sets the default compression method for compressible values.

name: default_transaction_deferrable
full_description: Category: Client Connection Defaults / Statement Behavior. Context: user. Description: Sets the default deferrable status of new transactions.

name: default_transaction_isolation
full_description: Category: Client Connection Defaults / Statement Behavior. Context: user. Description: Sets the transaction isolation level of each new transaction.

name: default_transaction_read_only
full_description: Category: Client Connection Defaults / Statement Behavior. Context: user. Description: Sets the default read-only status of new transactions.

name: dynamic_library_path
full_description: Category: Client Connection Defaults / Other Defaults. Context: superuser. Description: Sets the path for dynamically loadable modules. If a dynamically loadable module needs to be opened and the specified name does not have a directory component (i.e., the name does not contain a slash), the system will search this path for the specified file.

name: dynamic_shared_memory_type
full_description: Category: Resource Usage / Memory. Context: postmaster. Description: Selects the dynamic shared memory implementation used.

name: effective_cache_size
full_description: Category: Query Tuning / Planner Cost Constants. Context: user. Description: Sets the planner's assumption about the total size of the data caches. That is, the total size of the caches (kernel cache and shared buffers) used for PostgreSQL data files. This is measured in disk pages, which are normally 8 kB each.

name: effective_io_concurrency
full_description: Category: Resource Usage / Asynchronous Behavior. Context: user. Description: Number of simultaneous requests that can be handled efficiently by the disk subsystem.

name: enable_async_append
full_description: Category: Query Tuning / Planner Method Configuration. Context: user. Description: Enables the planner's use of async append plans.

name: enable_bitmapscan
full_description: Category: Query Tuning / Planner Method Configuration. Context: user. Description: Enables the planner's use of bitmap-scan plans.

name: enable_gathermerge
full_description: Category: Query Tuning / Planner Method Configuration. Context: user. Description: Enables the planner's use of gather merge plans.

name: enable_hashagg
full_description: Category: Query Tuning / Planner Method Configuration. Context: user. Description: Enables the planner's use of hashed aggregation plans.

name: enable_hashjoin
full_description: Category: Query Tuning / Planner Method Configuration. Context: user. Description: Enables the planner's use of hash join plans.

name: enable_incremental_sort
full_description: Category: Query Tuning / Planner Method Configuration. Context: user. Description: Enables the planner's use of incremental sort steps.

name: enable_indexonlyscan
full_description: Category: Query Tuning / Planner Method Configuration. Context: user. Description: Enables the planner's use of index-only-scan plans.

name: enable_indexscan
full_description: Category: Query Tuning / Planner Method Configuration. Context: user. Description: Enables the planner's use of index-scan plans.

name: enable_material
full_description: Category: Query Tuning / Planner Method Configuration. Context: user. Description: Enables the planner's use of materialization.

name: enable_memoize
full_description: Category: Query Tuning / Planner Method Configuration. Context: user. Description: Enables the planner's use of memoization.

name: enable_mergejoin
full_description: Category: Query Tuning / Planner Method Configuration. Context: user. Description: Enables the planner's use of merge join plans.

name: enable_nestloop
full_description: Category: Query Tuning / Planner Method Configuration. Context: user. Description: Enables the planner's use of nested-loop join plans.

name: enable_parallel_append
full_description: Category: Query Tuning / Planner Method Configuration. Context: user. Description: Enables the planner's use of parallel append plans.

name: enable_parallel_hash
full_description: Category: Query Tuning / Planner Method Configuration. Context: user. Description: Enables the planner's use of parallel hash plans.

name: enable_partition_pruning
full_description: Category: Query Tuning / Planner Method Configuration. Context: user. Description: Enables plan-time and execution-time partition pruning. Allows the query planner and executor to compare partition bounds to conditions in the query to determine which partitions must be scanned.

name: enable_partitionwise_aggregate
full_description: Category: Query Tuning / Planner Method Configuration. Context: user. Description: Enables partitionwise aggregation and grouping.

name: enable_partitionwise_join
full_description: Category: Query Tuning / Planner Method Configuration. Context: user. Description: Enables partitionwise join.

name: enable_seqscan
full_description: Category: Query Tuning / Planner Method Configuration. Context: user. Description: Enables the planner's use of sequential-scan plans.

name: enable_sort
full_description: Category: Query Tuning / Planner Method Configuration. Context: user. Description: Enables the planner's use of explicit sort steps.

name: enable_tidscan
full_description: Category: Query Tuning / Planner Method Configuration. Context: user. Description: Enables the planner's use of TID scan plans.

name: escape_string_warning
full_description: Category: Version and Platform Compatibility / Previous PostgreSQL Versions. Context: user. Description: Warn about backslash escapes in ordinary string literals.

name: event_source
full_description: Category: Reporting and Logging / Where to Log. Context: postmaster. Description: Sets the application name used to identify PostgreSQL messages in the event log.

name: exit_on_error
full_description: Category: Error Handling. Context: user. Description: Terminate session on any error.

name: extension_destdir
full_description: Category: File Locations. Context: superuser. Description: Path to prepend for extension loading This directory is prepended to paths when loading extensions (control and SQL files), and to the '$libdir' directive when loading modules that back functions. The location is made configurable to allow build-time testing of extensions that do not have been installed to their proper location yet.

name: external_pid_file
full_description: Category: File Locations. Context: postmaster. Description: Writes the postmaster PID to the specified file.

name: extra_float_digits
full_description: Category: Client Connection Defaults / Locale and Formatting. Context: user. Description: Sets the number of digits displayed for floating-point values. This affects real, double precision, and geometric data types. A zero or negative parameter value is added to the standard number of digits (FLT_DIG or DBL_DIG as appropriate). Any value greater than zero selects precise output mode.

name: force_parallel_mode
full_description: Category: Developer Options. Context: user. Description: Forces use of parallel query facilities. If possible, run query using a parallel worker and with parallel restrictions.

name: from_collapse_limit
full_description: Category: Query Tuning / Other Planner Options. Context: user. Description: Sets the FROM-list size beyond which subqueries are not collapsed. The planner will merge subqueries into upper queries if the resulting FROM list would have no more than this many items.

name: fsync
full_description: Category: Write-Ahead Log / Settings. Context: sighup. Description: Forces synchronization of updates to disk. The server will use the fsync() system call in several places to make sure that updates are physically written to disk. This ensures that a database cluster will recover to a consistent state after an operating system or hardware crash.

name: full_page_writes
full_description: Category: Write-Ahead Log / Settings. Context: sighup. Description: Writes full pages to WAL when first modified after a checkpoint. A page write in process during an operating system crash might be only partially written to disk. During recovery, the row changes stored in WAL are not enough to recover. This option writes pages when first modified after a checkpoint to WAL so full recovery is possible.

name: geqo
full_description: Category: Query Tuning / Genetic Query Optimizer. Context: user. Description: Enables genetic query optimization. This algorithm attempts to do planning without exhaustive searching.

name: geqo_effort
full_description: Category: Query Tuning / Genetic Query Optimizer. Context: user. Description: GEQO: effort is used to set the default for other GEQO parameters.

name: geqo_generations
full_description: Category: Query Tuning / Genetic Query Optimizer. Context: user. Description: GEQO: number of iterations of the algorithm. Zero selects a suitable default value.

name: geqo_pool_size
full_description: Category: Query Tuning / Genetic Query Optimizer. Context: user. Description: GEQO: number of individuals in the population. Zero selects a suitable default value.

name: geqo_seed
full_description: Category: Query Tuning / Genetic Query Optimizer. Context: user. Description: GEQO: seed for random path selection.

name: geqo_selection_bias
full_description: Category: Query Tuning / Genetic Query Optimizer. Context: user. Description: GEQO: selective pressure within the population.

name: geqo_threshold
full_description: Category: Query Tuning / Genetic Query Optimizer. Context: user. Description: Sets the threshold of FROM items beyond which GEQO is used.

name: gin_fuzzy_search_limit
full_description: Category: Client Connection Defaults / Other Defaults. Context: user. Description: Sets the maximum allowed result for exact search by GIN.

name: gin_pending_list_limit
full_description: Category: Client Connection Defaults / Statement Behavior. Context: user. Description: Sets the maximum size of the pending list for GIN index.

name: hash_mem_multiplier
full_description: Category: Resource Usage / Memory. Context: user. Description: Multiple of work_mem to use for hash tables.

name: hba_file
full_description: Category: File Locations. Context: postmaster. Description: Sets the server's "hba" configuration file.

name: hot_standby
full_description: Category: Replication / Standby Servers. Context: postmaster. Description: Allows connections and queries during recovery.

name: hot_standby_feedback
full_description: Category: Replication / Standby Servers. Context: sighup. Description: Allows feedback from a hot standby to the primary that will avoid query conflicts.

name: huge_page_size
full_description: Category: Resource Usage / Memory. Context: postmaster. Description: The size of huge page that should be requested.

name: huge_pages
full_description: Category: Resource Usage / Memory. Context: postmaster. Description: Use of huge pages on Linux or Windows.

name: ident_file
full_description: Category: File Locations. Context: postmaster. Description: Sets the server's "ident" configuration file.

name: idle_in_transaction_session_timeout
full_description: Category: Client Connection Defaults / Statement Behavior. Context: user. Description: Sets the maximum allowed idle time between queries, when in a transaction. A value of 0 turns off the timeout.

name: idle_session_timeout
full_description: Category: Client Connection Defaults / Statement Behavior. Context: user. Description: Sets the maximum allowed idle time between queries, when not in a transaction. A value of 0 turns off the timeout.

name: ignore_checksum_failure
full_description: Category: Developer Options. Context: superuser. Description: Continues processing after a checksum failure. Detection of a checksum failure normally causes PostgreSQL to report an error, aborting the current transaction. Setting ignore_checksum_failure to true causes the system to ignore the failure (but still report a warning), and continue processing. This behavior could cause crashes or other serious problems. Only has an effect if checksums are enabled.

name: ignore_invalid_pages
full_description: Category: Developer Options. Context: postmaster. Description: Continues recovery after an invalid pages failure. Detection of WAL records having references to invalid pages during recovery causes PostgreSQL to raise a PANIC-level error, aborting the recovery. Setting ignore_invalid_pages to true causes the system to ignore invalid page references in WAL records (but still report a warning), and continue recovery. This behavior may cause crashes, data loss, propagate or hide corruption, or other serious problems. Only has an effect during recovery or in standby mode.

name: ignore_system_indexes
full_description: Category: Developer Options. Context: backend. Description: Disables reading from system indexes. It does not prevent updating the indexes, so it is safe to use. The worst consequence is slowness.

name: in_hot_standby
full_description: Category: Preset Options. Context: internal. Description: Shows whether hot standby is currently active.

name: integer_datetimes
full_description: Category: Preset Options. Context: internal. Description: Shows whether datetimes are integer based.

name: jit
full_description: Category: Query Tuning / Other Planner Options. Context: user. Description: Allow JIT compilation.

name: jit_above_cost
full_description: Category: Query Tuning / Planner Cost Constants. Context: user. Description: Perform JIT compilation if query is more expensive. -1 disables JIT compilation.

name: jit_debugging_support
full_description: Category: Developer Options. Context: superuser-backend. Description: Register JIT-compiled functions with debugger.

name: jit_dump_bitcode
full_description: Category: Developer Options. Context: superuser. Description: Write out LLVM bitcode to facilitate JIT debugging.

name: jit_expressions
full_description: Category: Developer Options. Context: user. Description: Allow JIT compilation of expressions.

name: jit_inline_above_cost
full_description: Category: Query Tuning / Planner Cost Constants. Context: user. Description: Perform JIT inlining if query is more expensive. -1 disables inlining.

name: jit_optimize_above_cost
full_description: Category: Query Tuning / Planner Cost Constants. Context: user. Description: Optimize JIT-compiled functions if query is more expensive. -1 disables optimization.

name: jit_profiling_support
full_description: Category: Developer Options. Context: superuser-backend. Description: Register JIT-compiled functions with perf profiler.

name: jit_provider
full_description: Category: Client Connection Defaults / Shared Library Preloading. Context: postmaster. Description: JIT provider to use.

name: jit_tuple_deforming
full_description: Category: Developer Options. Context: user. Description: Allow JIT compilation of tuple deforming.

name: join_collapse_limit
full_description: Category: Query Tuning / Other Planner Options. Context: user. Description: Sets the FROM-list size beyond which JOIN constructs are not flattened. The planner will flatten explicit JOIN constructs into lists of FROM items whenever a list of no more than this many items would result.

name: krb_caseins_users
full_description: Category: Connections and Authentication / Authentication. Context: sighup. Description: Sets whether Kerberos and GSSAPI user names should be treated as case-insensitive.

name: krb_server_keyfile
full_description: Category: Connections and Authentication / Authentication. Context: sighup. Description: Sets the location of the Kerberos server key file.

name: lc_collate
full_description: Category: Preset Options. Context: internal. Description: Shows the collation order locale.

name: lc_ctype
full_description: Category: Preset Options. Context: internal. Description: Shows the character classification and case conversion locale.

name: lc_messages
full_description: Category: Client Connection Defaults / Locale and Formatting. Context: superuser. Description: Sets the language in which messages are displayed.

name: lc_monetary
full_description: Category: Client Connection Defaults / Locale and Formatting. Context: user. Description: Sets the locale for formatting monetary amounts.

name: lc_numeric
full_description: Category: Client Connection Defaults / Locale and Formatting. Context: user. Description: Sets the locale for formatting numbers.

name: lc_time
full_description: Category: Client Connection Defaults / Locale and Formatting. Context: user. Description: Sets the locale for formatting date and time values.

name: listen_addresses
full_description: Category: Connections and Authentication / Connection Settings. Context: postmaster. Description: Sets the host name or IP address(es) to listen to.

name: lo_compat_privileges
full_description: Category: Version and Platform Compatibility / Previous PostgreSQL Versions. Context: superuser. Description: Enables backward compatibility mode for privilege checks on large objects. Skips privilege checks when reading or modifying large objects, for compatibility with PostgreSQL releases prior to 9.0.

name: local_preload_libraries
full_description: Category: Client Connection Defaults / Shared Library Preloading. Context: user. Description: Lists unprivileged shared libraries to preload into each backend.

name: lock_timeout
full_description: Category: Client Connection Defaults / Statement Behavior. Context: user. Description: Sets the maximum allowed duration of any wait for a lock. A value of 0 turns off the timeout.

name: log_autovacuum_min_duration
full_description: Category: Reporting and Logging / What to Log. Context: sighup. Description: Sets the minimum execution time above which autovacuum actions will be logged. Zero prints all actions. -1 turns autovacuum logging off.

name: log_checkpoints
full_description: Category: Reporting and Logging / What to Log. Context: sighup. Description: Logs each checkpoint.

name: log_connections
full_description: Category: Reporting and Logging / What to Log. Context: superuser-backend. Description: Logs each successful connection.

name: log_destination
full_description: Category: Reporting and Logging / Where to Log. Context: sighup. Description: Sets the destination for server log output. Valid values are combinations of "stderr", "syslog", "csvlog", and "eventlog", depending on the platform.

name: log_directory
full_description: Category: Reporting and Logging / Where to Log. Context: sighup. Description: Sets the destination directory for log files. Can be specified as relative to the data directory or as absolute path.

name: log_disconnections
full_description: Category: Reporting and Logging / What to Log. Context: superuser-backend. Description: Logs end of a session, including duration.

name: log_duration
full_description: Category: Reporting and Logging / What to Log. Context: superuser. Description: Logs the duration of each completed SQL statement.

name: log_error_verbosity
full_description: Category: Reporting and Logging / What to Log. Context: superuser. Description: Sets the verbosity of logged messages.

name: log_executor_stats
full_description: Category: Statistics / Monitoring. Context: superuser. Description: Writes executor performance statistics to the server log.

name: log_file_mode
full_description: Category: Reporting and Logging / Where to Log. Context: sighup. Description: Sets the file permissions for log files. The parameter value is expected to be a numeric mode specification in the form accepted by the chmod and umask system calls. (To use the customary octal format the number must start with a 0 (zero).)

name: log_filename
full_description: Category: Reporting and Logging / Where to Log. Context: sighup. Description: Sets the file name pattern for log files.

name: log_hostname
full_description: Category: Reporting and Logging / What to Log. Context: sighup. Description: Logs the host name in the connection logs. By default, connection logs only show the IP address of the connecting host. If you want them to show the host name you can turn this on, but depending on your host name resolution setup it might impose a non-negligible performance penalty.

name: log_line_prefix
full_description: Category: Reporting and Logging / What to Log. Context: sighup. Description: Controls information prefixed to each log line. If blank, no prefix is used.

name: log_lock_waits
full_description: Category: Reporting and Logging / What to Log. Context: superuser. Description: Logs long lock waits.

name: log_min_duration_sample
full_description: Category: Reporting and Logging / When to Log. Context: superuser. Description: Sets the minimum execution time above which a sample of statements will be logged. Sampling is determined by log_statement_sample_rate. Zero logs a sample of all queries. -1 turns this feature off.

name: log_min_duration_statement
full_description: Category: Reporting and Logging / When to Log. Context: superuser. Description: Sets the minimum execution time above which all statements will be logged. Zero prints all queries. -1 turns this feature off.

name: log_min_error_statement
full_description: Category: Reporting and Logging / When to Log. Context: superuser. Description: Causes all statements generating error at or above this level to be logged. Each level includes all the levels that follow it. The later the level, the fewer messages are sent.

name: log_min_messages
full_description: Category: Reporting and Logging / When to Log. Context: superuser. Description: Sets the message levels that are logged. Each level includes all the levels that follow it. The later the level, the fewer messages are sent.

name: log_parameter_max_length
full_description: Category: Reporting and Logging / What to Log. Context: superuser. Description: When logging statements, limit logged parameter values to first N bytes. -1 to print values in full.

name: log_parameter_max_length_on_error
full_description: Category: Reporting and Logging / What to Log. Context: user. Description: When reporting an error, limit logged parameter values to first N bytes. -1 to print values in full.

name: log_parser_stats
full_description: Category: Statistics / Monitoring. Context: superuser. Description: Writes parser performance statistics to the server log.

name: log_planner_stats
full_description: Category: Statistics / Monitoring. Context: superuser. Description: Writes planner performance statistics to the server log.

name: log_recovery_conflict_waits
full_description: Category: Reporting and Logging / What to Log. Context: sighup. Description: Logs standby recovery conflict waits.

name: log_replication_commands
full_description: Category: Reporting and Logging / What to Log. Context: superuser. Description: Logs each replication command.

name: log_rotation_age
full_description: Category: Reporting and Logging / Where to Log. Context: sighup. Description: Automatic log file rotation will occur after N minutes.

name: log_rotation_size
full_description: Category: Reporting and Logging / Where to Log. Context: sighup. Description: Automatic log file rotation will occur after N kilobytes.

name: log_statement
full_description: Category: Reporting and Logging / What to Log. Context: superuser. Description: Sets the type of statements logged.

name: log_statement_sample_rate
full_description: Category: Reporting and Logging / When to Log. Context: superuser. Description: Fraction of statements exceeding log_min_duration_sample to be logged. Use a value between 0.0 (never log) and 1.0 (always log).

name: log_statement_stats
full_description: Category: Statistics / Monitoring. Context: superuser. Description: Writes cumulative performance statistics to the server log.

name: log_temp_files
full_description: Category: Reporting and Logging / What to Log. Context: superuser. Description: Log the use of temporary files larger than this number of kilobytes. Zero logs all files. The default is -1 (turning this feature off).

name: log_timezone
full_description: Category: Reporting and Logging / What to Log. Context: sighup. Description: Sets the time zone to use in log messages.

name: log_transaction_sample_rate
full_description: Category: Reporting and Logging / When to Log. Context: superuser. Description: Sets the fraction of transactions from which to log all statements. Use a value between 0.0 (never log) and 1.0 (log all statements for all transactions).

name: log_truncate_on_rotation
full_description: Category: Reporting and Logging / Where to Log. Context: sighup. Description: Truncate existing log files of same name during log rotation.

name: logging_collector
full_description: Category: Reporting and Logging / Where to Log. Context: postmaster. Description: Start a subprocess to capture stderr, csvlog and/or jsonlog into log files.

name: logical_decoding_work_mem
full_description: Category: Resource Usage / Memory. Context: user. Description: Sets the maximum memory to be used for logical decoding. This much memory can be used by each internal reorder buffer before spilling to disk.

name: maintenance_io_concurrency
full_description: Category: Resource Usage / Asynchronous Behavior. Context: user. Description: A variant of effective_io_concurrency that is used for maintenance work.

name: maintenance_work_mem
full_description: Category: Resource Usage / Memory. Context: user. Description: Sets the maximum memory to be used for maintenance operations. This includes operations such as VACUUM and CREATE INDEX.

name: max_connections
full_description: Category: Connections and Authentication / Connection Settings. Context: postmaster. Description: Sets the maximum number of concurrent connections.

name: max_files_per_process
full_description: Category: Resource Usage / Kernel Resources. Context: postmaster. Description: Sets the maximum number of simultaneously open files for each server process.

name: max_function_args
full_description: Category: Preset Options. Context: internal. Description: Shows the maximum number of function arguments.

name: max_identifier_length
full_description: Category: Preset Options. Context: internal. Description: Shows the maximum identifier length.

name: max_index_keys
full_description: Category: Preset Options. Context: internal. Description: Shows the maximum number of index keys.

name: max_locks_per_transaction
full_description: Category: Lock Management. Context: postmaster. Description: Sets the maximum number of locks per transaction. The shared lock table is sized on the assumption that at most max_locks_per_transaction * max_connections distinct objects will need to be locked at any one time.

name: max_logical_replication_workers
full_description: Category: Replication / Subscribers. Context: postmaster. Description: Maximum number of logical replication worker processes.

name: max_parallel_maintenance_workers
full_description: Category: Resource Usage / Asynchronous Behavior. Context: user. Description: Sets the maximum number of parallel processes per maintenance operation.

name: max_parallel_workers
full_description: Category: Resource Usage / Asynchronous Behavior. Context: user. Description: Sets the maximum number of parallel workers that can be active at one time.

name: max_parallel_workers_per_gather
full_description: Category: Resource Usage / Asynchronous Behavior. Context: user. Description: Sets the maximum number of parallel processes per executor node.

name: max_pred_locks_per_page
full_description: Category: Lock Management. Context: sighup. Description: Sets the maximum number of predicate-locked tuples per page. If more than this number of tuples on the same page are locked by a connection, those locks are replaced by a page-level lock.

name: max_pred_locks_per_relation
full_description: Category: Lock Management. Context: sighup. Description: Sets the maximum number of predicate-locked pages and tuples per relation. If more than this total of pages and tuples in the same relation are locked by a connection, those locks are replaced by a relation-level lock.

name: max_pred_locks_per_transaction
full_description: Category: Lock Management. Context: postmaster. Description: Sets the maximum number of predicate locks per transaction. The shared predicate lock table is sized on the assumption that at most max_pred_locks_per_transaction * max_connections distinct objects will need to be locked at any one time.

name: max_prepared_transactions
full_description: Category: Resource Usage / Memory. Context: postmaster. Description: Sets the maximum number of simultaneously prepared transactions.

name: max_replication_slots
full_description: Category: Replication / Sending Servers. Context: postmaster. Description: Sets the maximum number of simultaneously defined replication slots.

name: max_slot_wal_keep_size
full_description: Category: Replication / Sending Servers. Context: sighup. Description: Sets the maximum WAL size that can be reserved by replication slots. Replication slots will be marked as failed, and segments released for deletion or recycling, if this much space is occupied by WAL on disk.

name: max_stack_depth
full_description: Category: Resource Usage / Memory. Context: superuser. Description: Sets the maximum stack depth, in kilobytes.

name: max_standby_archive_delay
full_description: Category: Replication / Standby Servers. Context: sighup. Description: Sets the maximum delay before canceling queries when a hot standby server is processing archived WAL data.

name: max_standby_streaming_delay
full_description: Category: Replication / Standby Servers. Context: sighup. Description: Sets the maximum delay before canceling queries when a hot standby server is processing streamed WAL data.

name: max_sync_workers_per_subscription
full_description: Category: Replication / Subscribers. Context: sighup. Description: Maximum number of table synchronization workers per subscription.

name: max_wal_senders
full_description: Category: Replication / Sending Servers. Context: postmaster. Description: Sets the maximum number of simultaneously running WAL sender processes.

name: max_wal_size
full_description: Category: Write-Ahead Log / Checkpoints. Context: sighup. Description: Sets the WAL size that triggers a checkpoint.

name: max_worker_processes
full_description: Category: Resource Usage / Asynchronous Behavior. Context: postmaster. Description: Maximum number of concurrent worker processes.

name: min_dynamic_shared_memory
full_description: Category: Resource Usage / Memory. Context: postmaster. Description: Amount of dynamic shared memory reserved at startup.

name: min_parallel_index_scan_size
full_description: Category: Query Tuning / Planner Cost Constants. Context: user. Description: Sets the minimum amount of index data for a parallel scan. If the planner estimates that it will read a number of index pages too small to reach this limit, a parallel scan will not be considered.

name: min_parallel_table_scan_size
full_description: Category: Query Tuning / Planner Cost Constants. Context: user. Description: Sets the minimum amount of table data for a parallel scan. If the planner estimates that it will read a number of table pages too small to reach this limit, a parallel scan will not be considered.

name: min_wal_size
full_description: Category: Write-Ahead Log / Checkpoints. Context: sighup. Description: Sets the minimum size to shrink the WAL to.

name: old_snapshot_threshold
full_description: Category: Resource Usage / Asynchronous Behavior. Context: postmaster. Description: Time before a snapshot is too old to read pages changed after the snapshot was taken. A value of -1 disables this feature.

name: parallel_leader_participation
full_description: Category: Resource Usage / Asynchronous Behavior. Context: user. Description: Controls whether Gather and Gather Merge also run subplans. Should gather nodes also run subplans or just gather tuples?

name: parallel_setup_cost
full_description: Category: Query Tuning / Planner Cost Constants. Context: user. Description: Sets the planner's estimate of the cost of starting up worker processes for parallel query.

name: parallel_tuple_cost
full_description: Category: Query Tuning / Planner Cost Constants. Context: user. Description: Sets the planner's estimate of the cost of passing each tuple (row) from worker to leader backend.

name: password_encryption
full_description: Category: Connections and Authentication / Authentication. Context: user. Description: Chooses the algorithm for encrypting passwords.

name: plan_cache_mode
full_description: Category: Query Tuning / Other Planner Options. Context: user. Description: Controls the planner's selection of custom or generic plan. Prepared statements can have custom and generic plans, and the planner will attempt to choose which is better. This can be set to override the default behavior.

name: port
full_description: Category: Connections and Authentication / Connection Settings. Context: postmaster. Description: Sets the TCP port the server listens on.

name: post_auth_delay
full_description: Category: Developer Options. Context: backend. Description: Waits N seconds on connection startup after authentication. This allows attaching a debugger to the process.

name: pre_auth_delay
full_description: Category: Developer Options. Context: sighup. Description: Waits N seconds on connection startup before authentication. This allows attaching a debugger to the process.

name: primary_conninfo
full_description: Category: Replication / Standby Servers. Context: sighup. Description: Sets the connection string to be used to connect to the sending server.

name: primary_slot_name
full_description: Category: Replication / Standby Servers. Context: sighup. Description: Sets the name of the replication slot to use on the sending server.

name: promote_trigger_file
full_description: Category: Replication / Standby Servers. Context: sighup. Description: Specifies a file name whose presence ends recovery in the standby.

name: quote_all_identifiers
full_description: Category: Version and Platform Compatibility / Previous PostgreSQL Versions. Context: user. Description: When generating SQL fragments, quote all identifiers.

name: random_page_cost
full_description: Category: Query Tuning / Planner Cost Constants. Context: user. Description: Sets the planner's estimate of the cost of a nonsequentially fetched disk page.

name: recovery_end_command
full_description: Category: Write-Ahead Log / Archive Recovery. Context: sighup. Description: Sets the shell command that will be executed once at the end of recovery.

name: recovery_init_sync_method
full_description: Category: Error Handling. Context: sighup. Description: Sets the method for synchronizing the data directory before crash recovery.

name: recovery_min_apply_delay
full_description: Category: Replication / Standby Servers. Context: sighup. Description: Sets the minimum delay for applying changes during recovery.

name: recovery_target
full_description: Category: Write-Ahead Log / Recovery Target. Context: postmaster. Description: Set to "immediate" to end recovery as soon as a consistent state is reached.

name: recovery_target_action
full_description: Category: Write-Ahead Log / Recovery Target. Context: postmaster. Description: Sets the action to perform upon reaching the recovery target.

name: recovery_target_inclusive
full_description: Category: Write-Ahead Log / Recovery Target. Context: postmaster. Description: Sets whether to include or exclude transaction with recovery target.

name: recovery_target_lsn
full_description: Category: Write-Ahead Log / Recovery Target. Context: postmaster. Description: Sets the LSN of the write-ahead log location up to which recovery will proceed.

name: recovery_target_name
full_description: Category: Write-Ahead Log / Recovery Target. Context: postmaster. Description: Sets the named restore point up to which recovery will proceed.

name: recovery_target_time
full_description: Category: Write-Ahead Log / Recovery Target. Context: postmaster. Description: Sets the time stamp up to which recovery will proceed.

name: recovery_target_timeline
full_description: Category: Write-Ahead Log / Recovery Target. Context: postmaster. Description: Specifies the timeline to recover into.

name: recovery_target_xid
full_description: Category: Write-Ahead Log / Recovery Target. Context: postmaster. Description: Sets the transaction ID up to which recovery will proceed.

name: remove_temp_files_after_crash
full_description: Category: Developer Options. Context: sighup. Description: Remove temporary files after backend crash.

name: restart_after_crash
full_description: Category: Error Handling. Context: sighup. Description: Reinitialize server after backend crash.

name: restore_command
full_description: Category: Write-Ahead Log / Archive Recovery. Context: sighup. Description: Sets the shell command that will be called to retrieve an archived WAL file.

name: restrict_nonsystem_relation_kind
full_description: Category: Client Connection Defaults / Statement Behavior. Context: user. Description: Prohibits access to non-system relations of specified kinds.

name: row_security
full_description: Category: Client Connection Defaults / Statement Behavior. Context: user. Description: Enable row security. When enabled, row security will be applied to all users.

name: search_path
full_description: Category: Client Connection Defaults / Statement Behavior. Context: user. Description: Sets the schema search order for names that are not schema-qualified.

name: segment_size
full_description: Category: Preset Options. Context: internal. Description: Shows the number of pages per disk file.

name: seq_page_cost
full_description: Category: Query Tuning / Planner Cost Constants. Context: user. Description: Sets the planner's estimate of the cost of a sequentially fetched disk page.

name: server_encoding
full_description: Category: Preset Options. Context: internal. Description: Shows the server (database) character set encoding.

name: server_version
full_description: Category: Preset Options. Context: internal. Description: Shows the server version.

name: server_version_num
full_description: Category: Preset Options. Context: internal. Description: Shows the server version as an integer.

name: session_preload_libraries
full_description: Category: Client Connection Defaults / Shared Library Preloading. Context: superuser. Description: Lists shared libraries to preload into each backend.

name: session_replication_role
full_description: Category: Client Connection Defaults / Statement Behavior. Context: superuser. Description: Sets the session's behavior for triggers and rewrite rules.

name: shared_buffers
full_description: Category: Resource Usage / Memory. Context: postmaster. Description: Sets the number of shared memory buffers used by the server.

name: shared_memory_type
full_description: Category: Resource Usage / Memory. Context: postmaster. Description: Selects the shared memory implementation used for the main shared memory region.

name: shared_preload_libraries
full_description: Category: Client Connection Defaults / Shared Library Preloading. Context: postmaster. Description: Lists shared libraries to preload into server.

name: ssl
full_description: Category: Connections and Authentication / SSL. Context: sighup. Description: Enables SSL connections.

name: ssl_ca_file
full_description: Category: Connections and Authentication / SSL. Context: sighup. Description: Location of the SSL certificate authority file.

name: ssl_cert_file
full_description: Category: Connections and Authentication / SSL. Context: sighup. Description: Location of the SSL server certificate file.

name: ssl_ciphers
full_description: Category: Connections and Authentication / SSL. Context: sighup. Description: Sets the list of allowed SSL ciphers.

name: ssl_crl_dir
full_description: Category: Connections and Authentication / SSL. Context: sighup. Description: Location of the SSL certificate revocation list directory.

name: ssl_crl_file
full_description: Category: Connections and Authentication / SSL. Context: sighup. Description: Location of the SSL certificate revocation list file.

name: ssl_dh_params_file
full_description: Category: Connections and Authentication / SSL. Context: sighup. Description: Location of the SSL DH parameters file.

name: ssl_ecdh_curve
full_description: Category: Connections and Authentication / SSL. Context: sighup. Description: Sets the curve to use for ECDH.

name: ssl_key_file
full_description: Category: Connections and Authentication / SSL. Context: sighup. Description: Location of the SSL server private key file.

name: ssl_library
full_description: Category: Preset Options. Context: internal. Description: Shows the name of the SSL library.

name: ssl_max_protocol_version
full_description: Category: Connections and Authentication / SSL. Context: sighup. Description: Sets the maximum SSL/TLS protocol version to use.

name: ssl_min_protocol_version
full_description: Category: Connections and Authentication / SSL. Context: sighup. Description: Sets the minimum SSL/TLS protocol version to use.

name: ssl_passphrase_command
full_description: Category: Connections and Authentication / SSL. Context: sighup. Description: Command to obtain passphrases for SSL.

name: ssl_passphrase_command_supports_reload
full_description: Category: Connections and Authentication / SSL. Context: sighup. Description: Also use ssl_passphrase_command during server reload.

name: ssl_prefer_server_ciphers
full_description: Category: Connections and Authentication / SSL. Context: sighup. Description: Give priority to server ciphersuite order.

name: standard_conforming_strings
full_description: Category: Version and Platform Compatibility / Previous PostgreSQL Versions. Context: user. Description: Causes '...' strings to treat backslashes literally.

name: statement_timeout
full_description: Category: Client Connection Defaults / Statement Behavior. Context: user. Description: Sets the maximum allowed duration of any statement. A value of 0 turns off the timeout.

name: stats_temp_directory
full_description: Category: Statistics / Query and Index Statistics Collector. Context: sighup. Description: Writes temporary statistics files to the specified directory.

name: superuser_reserved_connections
full_description: Category: Connections and Authentication / Connection Settings. Context: postmaster. Description: Sets the number of connection slots reserved for superusers.

name: synchronize_seqscans
full_description: Category: Version and Platform Compatibility / Previous PostgreSQL Versions. Context: user. Description: Enable synchronized sequential scans.

name: synchronous_commit
full_description: Category: Write-Ahead Log / Settings. Context: user. Description: Sets the current transaction's synchronization level.

name: synchronous_standby_names
full_description: Category: Replication / Primary Server. Context: sighup. Description: Number of synchronous standbys and list of names of potential synchronous ones.

name: syslog_facility
full_description: Category: Reporting and Logging / Where to Log. Context: sighup. Description: Sets the syslog "facility" to be used when syslog enabled.

name: syslog_ident
full_description: Category: Reporting and Logging / Where to Log. Context: sighup. Description: Sets the program name used to identify PostgreSQL messages in syslog.

name: syslog_sequence_numbers
full_description: Category: Reporting and Logging / Where to Log. Context: sighup. Description: Add sequence number to syslog messages to avoid duplicate suppression.

name: syslog_split_messages
full_description: Category: Reporting and Logging / Where to Log. Context: sighup. Description: Split messages sent to syslog by lines and to fit into 1024 bytes.

name: tcp_keepalives_count
full_description: Category: Connections and Authentication / Connection Settings. Context: user. Description: Maximum number of TCP keepalive retransmits. This controls the number of consecutive keepalive retransmits that can be lost before a connection is considered dead. A value of 0 uses the system default.

name: tcp_keepalives_idle
full_description: Category: Connections and Authentication / Connection Settings. Context: user. Description: Time between issuing TCP keepalives. A value of 0 uses the system default.

name: tcp_keepalives_interval
full_description: Category: Connections and Authentication / Connection Settings. Context: user. Description: Time between TCP keepalive retransmits. A value of 0 uses the system default.

name: tcp_user_timeout
full_description: Category: Connections and Authentication / Connection Settings. Context: user. Description: TCP user timeout. A value of 0 uses the system default.

name: temp_buffers
full_description: Category: Resource Usage / Memory. Context: user. Description: Sets the maximum number of temporary buffers used by each session.

name: temp_file_limit
full_description: Category: Resource Usage / Disk. Context: superuser. Description: Limits the total size of all temporary files used by each process. -1 means no limit.

name: temp_tablespaces
full_description: Category: Client Connection Defaults / Statement Behavior. Context: user. Description: Sets the tablespace(s) to use for temporary tables and sort files.

name: timezone_abbreviations
full_description: Category: Client Connection Defaults / Locale and Formatting. Context: user. Description: Selects a file of time zone abbreviations.

name: trace_notify
full_description: Category: Developer Options. Context: user. Description: Generates debugging output for LISTEN and NOTIFY.

name: trace_recovery_messages
full_description: Category: Developer Options. Context: sighup. Description: Enables logging of recovery-related debugging information. Each level includes all the levels that follow it. The later the level, the fewer messages are sent.

name: trace_sort
full_description: Category: Developer Options. Context: user. Description: Emit information about resource usage in sorting.

name: track_activities
full_description: Category: Statistics / Query and Index Statistics Collector. Context: superuser. Description: Collects information about executing commands. Enables the collection of information on the currently executing command of each session, along with the time at which that command began execution.

name: track_activity_query_size
full_description: Category: Statistics / Query and Index Statistics Collector. Context: postmaster. Description: Sets the size reserved for pg_stat_activity.query, in bytes.

name: track_commit_timestamp
full_description: Category: Replication / Sending Servers. Context: postmaster. Description: Collects transaction commit time.

name: track_counts
full_description: Category: Statistics / Query and Index Statistics Collector. Context: superuser. Description: Collects statistics on database activity.

name: track_functions
full_description: Category: Statistics / Query and Index Statistics Collector. Context: superuser. Description: Collects function-level statistics on database activity.

name: track_io_timing
full_description: Category: Statistics / Query and Index Statistics Collector. Context: superuser. Description: Collects timing statistics for database I/O activity.

name: track_wal_io_timing
full_description: Category: Statistics / Query and Index Statistics Collector. Context: superuser. Description: Collects timing statistics for WAL I/O activity.

name: transaction_deferrable
full_description: Category: Client Connection Defaults / Statement Behavior. Context: user. Description: Whether to defer a read-only serializable transaction until it can be executed with no possible serialization failures.

name: transaction_isolation
full_description: Category: Client Connection Defaults / Statement Behavior. Context: user. Description: Sets the current transaction's isolation level.

name: transaction_read_only
full_description: Category: Client Connection Defaults / Statement Behavior. Context: user. Description: Sets the current transaction's read-only status.

name: transform_null_equals
full_description: Category: Version and Platform Compatibility / Other Platforms and Clients. Context: user. Description: Treats "expr=NULL" as "expr IS NULL". When turned on, expressions of the form expr = NULL (or NULL = expr) are treated as expr IS NULL, that is, they return true if expr evaluates to the null value, and false otherwise. The correct behavior of expr = NULL is to always return null (unknown).

name: unix_socket_directories
full_description: Category: Connections and Authentication / Connection Settings. Context: postmaster. Description: Sets the directories where Unix-domain sockets will be created.

name: unix_socket_group
full_description: Category: Connections and Authentication / Connection Settings. Context: postmaster. Description: Sets the owning group of the Unix-domain socket. The owning user of the socket is always the user that starts the server.

name: unix_socket_permissions
full_description: Category: Connections and Authentication / Connection Settings. Context: postmaster. Description: Sets the access permissions of the Unix-domain socket. Unix-domain sockets use the usual Unix file system permission set. The parameter value is expected to be a numeric mode specification in the form accepted by the chmod and umask system calls. (To use the customary octal format the number must start with a 0 (zero).)

name: update_process_title
full_description: Category: Reporting and Logging / Process Title. Context: superuser. Description: Updates the process title to show the active SQL command. Enables updating of the process title every time a new SQL command is received by the server.

name: vacuum_cost_delay
full_description: Category: Resource Usage / Cost-Based Vacuum Delay. Context: user. Description: Vacuum cost delay in milliseconds.

name: vacuum_cost_limit
full_description: Category: Resource Usage / Cost-Based Vacuum Delay. Context: user. Description: Vacuum cost amount available before napping.

name: vacuum_cost_page_dirty
full_description: Category: Resource Usage / Cost-Based Vacuum Delay. Context: user. Description: Vacuum cost for a page dirtied by vacuum.

name: vacuum_cost_page_hit
full_description: Category: Resource Usage / Cost-Based Vacuum Delay. Context: user. Description: Vacuum cost for a page found in the buffer cache.

name: vacuum_cost_page_miss
full_description: Category: Resource Usage / Cost-Based Vacuum Delay. Context: user. Description: Vacuum cost for a page not found in the buffer cache.

name: vacuum_defer_cleanup_age
full_description: Category: Replication / Primary Server. Context: sighup. Description: Number of transactions by which VACUUM and HOT cleanup should be deferred, if any.

name: vacuum_failsafe_age
full_description: Category: Client Connection Defaults / Statement Behavior. Context: user. Description: Age at which VACUUM should trigger failsafe to avoid a wraparound outage.

name: vacuum_freeze_min_age
full_description: Category: Client Connection Defaults / Statement Behavior. Context: user. Description: Minimum age at which VACUUM should freeze a table row.

name: vacuum_freeze_table_age
full_description: Category: Client Connection Defaults / Statement Behavior. Context: user. Description: Age at which VACUUM should scan whole table to freeze tuples.

name: vacuum_multixact_failsafe_age
full_description: Category: Client Connection Defaults / Statement Behavior. Context: user. Description: Multixact age at which VACUUM should trigger failsafe to avoid a wraparound outage.

name: vacuum_multixact_freeze_min_age
full_description: Category: Client Connection Defaults / Statement Behavior. Context: user. Description: Minimum age at which VACUUM should freeze a MultiXactId in a table row.

name: vacuum_multixact_freeze_table_age
full_description: Category: Client Connection Defaults / Statement Behavior. Context: user. Description: Multixact age at which VACUUM should scan whole table to freeze tuples.

name: wal_block_size
full_description: Category: Preset Options. Context: internal. Description: Shows the block size in the write ahead log.

name: wal_buffers
full_description: Category: Write-Ahead Log / Settings. Context: postmaster. Description: Sets the number of disk-page buffers in shared memory for WAL.

name: wal_compression
full_description: Category: Write-Ahead Log / Settings. Context: superuser. Description: Compresses full-page writes written in WAL file.

name: wal_consistency_checking
full_description: Category: Developer Options. Context: superuser. Description: Sets the WAL resource managers for which WAL consistency checks are done. Full-page images will be logged for all data blocks and cross-checked against the results of WAL replay.

name: wal_init_zero
full_description: Category: Write-Ahead Log / Settings. Context: superuser. Description: Writes zeroes to new WAL files before first use.

name: wal_keep_size
full_description: Category: Replication / Sending Servers. Context: sighup. Description: Sets the size of WAL files held for standby servers.

name: wal_level
full_description: Category: Write-Ahead Log / Settings. Context: postmaster. Description: Sets the level of information written to the WAL.

name: wal_log_hints
full_description: Category: Write-Ahead Log / Settings. Context: postmaster. Description: Writes full pages to WAL when first modified after a checkpoint, even for a non-critical modification.

name: wal_receiver_create_temp_slot
full_description: Category: Replication / Standby Servers. Context: sighup. Description: Sets whether a WAL receiver should create a temporary replication slot if no permanent slot is configured.

name: wal_receiver_status_interval
full_description: Category: Replication / Standby Servers. Context: sighup. Description: Sets the maximum interval between WAL receiver status reports to the sending server.

name: wal_receiver_timeout
full_description: Category: Replication / Standby Servers. Context: sighup. Description: Sets the maximum wait time to receive data from the sending server.

name: wal_recycle
full_description: Category: Write-Ahead Log / Settings. Context: superuser. Description: Recycles WAL files by renaming them.

name: wal_retrieve_retry_interval
full_description: Category: Replication / Standby Servers. Context: sighup. Description: Sets the time to wait before retrying to retrieve WAL after a failed attempt.

name: wal_segment_size
full_description: Category: Preset Options. Context: internal. Description: Shows the size of write ahead log segments.

name: wal_sender_timeout
full_description: Category: Replication / Sending Servers. Context: user. Description: Sets the maximum time to wait for WAL replication.

name: wal_skip_threshold
full_description: Category: Write-Ahead Log / Settings. Context: user. Description: Minimum size of new file to fsync instead of writing WAL.

name: wal_sync_method
full_description: Category: Write-Ahead Log / Settings. Context: sighup. Description: Selects the method used for forcing WAL updates to disk.

name: wal_writer_delay
full_description: Category: Write-Ahead Log / Settings. Context: sighup. Description: Time between WAL flushes performed in the WAL writer.

name: wal_writer_flush_after
full_description: Category: Write-Ahead Log / Settings. Context: sighup. Description: Amount of WAL written out by WAL writer that triggers a flush.

name: work_mem
full_description: Category: Resource Usage / Memory. Context: user. Description: Sets the maximum memory to be used for query workspaces. This much memory can be used by each internal sort operation and hash table before switching to temporary disk files.

name: xmlbinary
full_description: Category: Client Connection Defaults / Statement Behavior. Context: user. Description: Sets how binary values are to be encoded in XML.

name: xmloption
full_description: Category: Client Connection Defaults / Statement Behavior. Context: user. Description: Sets whether XML data in implicit parsing and serialization operations is to be considered as documents or content fragments.

name: zero_damaged_pages
full_description: Category: Developer Options. Context: superuser. Description: Continues processing past damaged page headers. Detection of a damaged page header normally causes PostgreSQL to report an error, aborting the current transaction. Setting zero_damaged_pages to true causes the system to instead report a warning, zero out the damaged page, and continue processing. This behavior will destroy data, namely all the rows on the damaged page.
